definitions.explanation_en: To fail to remember information, an event, or a person, either temporarily or permanently, often due to lack of attention, distraction, or the passage of time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能记住信息、事件或人物，可能是暂时的，也可能是永久的，通常由于注意力不集中、分心或时间流逝所致。
definitions.example_en: She forgets her keys every morning, no matter how many times she’s reminded.
definitions.example_cn: 她每天早上都会忘记带钥匙，无论别人提醒多少次。

definitions.explanation_en: To intentionally disregard or ignore something, often to avoid discomfort or responsibility, as if it were forgotten.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有意忽视或忽略某事，常为避免不适或推卸责任，仿佛此事已被遗忘。
definitions.example_en: He forgets his promises whenever it’s inconvenient to keep them.
definitions.example_cn: 每当遵守承诺不方便时，他就假装忘了自己说过的话。

definitions.explanation_en: To cease to be aware of or preoccupied with something, especially a worry or pain, as if it has faded from memory.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指不再意识到或纠结于某事，尤其是担忧或痛苦，仿佛它已从记忆中淡去。
definitions.example_en: After the vacation, she forgot all her work-related stress.
definitions.example_cn: 度假之后，她把所有工作压力都抛在了脑后。

comparison.analysis: “Remembers”（记得）是 “forgets” 的直接反义词，强调对信息、经历或承诺的保留与回忆能力。而 “forgets” 则突出记忆的缺失或失效，两者构成认知行为的对立面。
“Overlooks”（忽视）通常指有意或无意地未注意到某事，但不一定涉及记忆的丧失；它更侧重于感知或关注的缺失。而 “forgets” 强调记忆内容的消退，即使曾经注意过，现在也想不起来了。
“Neglects”（疏忽）强调因不重视或不负责任而未做应做的事，常带有道德或义务层面的批评。而 “forgets” 更中性，可能只是认知失误，不必然代表故意或懒惰。
